text: Ronnie Robinson (March 9, 1951 – May 8, 2004)Ronnie Robinson page at DatabaseBasketball.comBasketball-Reference.com page on Ronnie RobinsonUniversity of Memphis Athletics official site was an American basketball player. Robinson played high school basketball at Memphis Melrose High School, where one of his teammates was his future college and professional teammate, Larry Finch.University of Memphis Athletics official site Robinson played college basketball in his hometown at Memphis State University.Ronnie Robinson page at DatabaseBasketball.comBasketball- Reference.com page on Ronnie Robinson Robinson, Finch and Larry Kenon led Memphis State to the 1973 Final Four; the Tigers lost to the undefeated, Bill Walton-led UCLA Bruins in the Finals.University of Memphis Athletics official site Affectionately nicknamed "The Big Cat" for his leaping ability, Robinson is one of eight University of Memphis Tigers basketball players to have his jersey number retired by the school.University of Memphis Athletics official site A 6'8", 225 pound forward, Robinson finished his college career prior to the ABA-NBA merger and thus was selected in the fourth round of the 1973 NBA Draft by the Phoenix Suns and in the first round of the 1973 ABA Draft by the Utah Stars.Ronnie Robinson page at DatabaseBasketball.comBasketball- Reference.com page on Ronnie Robinson Robinson opted for the American Basketball Association and began the 1973-74 season with the Stars. In January, the Memphis Tams traded Johnny Neumann to Utah for Robinson, Glen Combs, Mike Jackson and cash.Memphis Tams Year to Year Notes page at RememberTheABA.com With the Stars and Tams throughout the 1973-74 season, Robinson appeared in 62 games, averaging 6.4 points and 4.5 rebounds per game.Ronnie Robinson page at DatabaseBasketball.comBasketball-Reference.com page on Ronnie Robinson Robinson spent the 1974-75 season with the Memphis Sounds.Ronnie Robinson page at DatabaseBasketball.com With the Sounds, Robinson appeared in only 10 games, averaging 4.0 points and 2.7 rebounds per game.Ronnie Robinson page at DatabaseBasketball.com ==References== Category:1951 births Category:2004 deaths Category:Basketball players from Tennessee Category:Memphis Sounds players Category:Memphis Tams players Category:Memphis Tigers men's basketball players Category:Phoenix Suns draft picks Category:Sportspeople from Memphis, Tennessee Category:Utah Stars draft picks Category:Utah Stars players Category:American men's basketball players
title: Ronnie Robinson (basketball)
